channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The whole pathway covered in dead leaves, 16th December
item.description:
The entire pathway is covered in dead leaves for weeks now. Very dangerous when starts raining and the road is on the steep hill. These need to be removed asap.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Purrett Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking and Residential Impact, 16th December
item.description:
Parking & Resident Impact Non-residents leaving vehicles for several days or even weeks without moving. Multiple commercial vans being parked long-term on the street. Residents regularly unable to park near their homes due to long-stay vehicles. Parking pressure expected to worsen as new Sydenham Hill developments fill up. Safety Concerns Large vans blocking visibility for children and families walking to/from school. Reduced visibility at junctions and driveways due to oversized vehicles. Street Misuse Road increasingly being used as a storage area for non-resident commercial vehicles. Vehicles staying beyond reasonable durations for residential parking. Current school-hours parking restrictions not preventing long-stay occupation. Request to the Council Investigate the issue as it is happening daily and worsening. Assess the street for resident-priority parking measures.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Thorpewood Avenue, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins not emptied, 16th December
item.description:
Black bins not emptied on Monday, there was roadworks in the street but the recycling crew reversed down and emptied bins the crew responsible for the black bins could have done the same
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whitworth Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Toaster, carpet & other domestic waste left outside my building, 16th December
item.description:
Somebody dumped unwanted items outside the property where I live. These items are not just litter but items that should have been arranged for responsible waste collection. There are a toaster, carpet pieces. These been outside since the 12th December.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The yellow lines are hardly visible, 16th December
item.description:
Yellow lines from Meadway to Albermarle Road are faded, and people are parking on the corner, which may result in fines because they are parking on the lines. It is also difficult to see oncoming traffic when turning left out of Meadway. The lines need to be repainted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Easy access for homeless and drug dealers, 16th December
item.description:
The street lighting will be missing caused buy homeless and drug dealers. The love darkness and special around the area. Therefore, please repay It as soon as possible. They are also aggressive when it is dark...............hopefully tomorrow

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sidworth Street, Hackney, London
